intro: Centropogon foetidus, commonly known as the stinking nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades such as tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers and hairy stems. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and heathlands. Despite its unpleasant odor, it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for certain pollinators.
